toc_entry.title: THE NO DECADE
toc_entry.description: Like it or not, it’s time to start behaving yourself

toc_entry.title: THE PARTY'S OVER
toc_entry.description: In the early eighties, some Dallas savings and loans reaped profits in real estate investments while land was flipped, appraisals were inflated, and property was developed. Now the land deals have flopped, property values are deflated, and there are empty buildings all over town. And some S&Ls are broke

toc_entry.title: THE JEFFREY SHOW
toc_entry.description: Heads turn when he passes. He’s on half of Houston’s A-party list. Rock singer? Investment banker? Nope. Meet Father Jeffrey Walker, Episcopal priest

toc_entry.title: CULTURE CLUB
toc_entry.description: Once San Antonio’s elite took pride in their support of the city’s fine symphony. When the cream of that elite, the Symphony Society board, abruptly canceled the upcoming season, it was time for some soul-searching

toc_entry.title: CLINT MURCHISON, JR.
toc_entry.subtitle: TEXAS PRIMER
toc_entry.description: He was one tycoon who enjoyed the hell out of his money

toc_entry.title: SOMBREROS OF THE GODS?
toc_entry.description: For centuries, scientists have searched for the answers to the mystery of Nosehenge. Now—for the first time—the startling truth
toc_entry.byline: Text and illustrations by Brad Holland

toc_entry.title: THE LITTLE BLACK SUIT
toc_entry.description: It’s best accessorized with a shovel, a pail, and a beach blanket

toc_entry.title: EXTRA! PENGUIN’S ALTER EGO WINS PULITZER!
toc_entry.subtitle: LIFESTYLES
toc_entry.description: Equipped with only his passion for current events and the simple desire to amuse, Berke Breathed won himself the highest honor in his trade.

toc_entry.title: NEW KID ON THE BLOCK
toc_entry.subtitle: ART
toc_entry.description: The Menil Collection has received so much attention that its opening this month may seem anticlimactic. The only unknown is what the director plans to do with it all.

toc_entry.title: EXTREME IMITATION
toc_entry.subtitle: MOVIES
toc_entry.description: Extreme Prejudice trips over its bloody missteps; Heaven climbs a staircase to the stars; Prick Up Your Ears delivers crisp witticisms and cruisy pickups; Ishtar completely lacks l’amour.

toc_entry.title: GOOD VIBES
toc_entry.subtitle: JAZZ
toc_entry.description: Vibraharpist Charlie Shoemake keeps so busy in L.A. that he seldom strays back to his home state. Fortunately, we can hear him on new recordings.

toc_entry.title: THE ROAR OF THE CROWD
toc_entry.description: Prescribing medical remedies; pinching Lone Star pennies; debating the future of a university.

toc_entry.title: AROUND THE STATE
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: REPORTER
toc_entry.description: Texas oil patchers bounce back; Houston artist Staley paints the art crowd; goat-gland genius Brinkley’s mansion casts its quirky spell. Plus: Caroline Schoellkopf’s marital woes, Tammy Faye Bakker’s impersonators, and Nancy Negley Wellin’s prodigal daughter.

toc_entry.title: THE NATIONAL TOUR OF TEXAS
toc_entry.description: From the harsh landscape of the Permian Basin, whose residents find their faith in free enterprise tested by hard times; to the subtropical city of San Antonio, whose Hispanic citizens have gone gaga over Goyo-Goyo; into deepest South Texas, where the old times of the Parr machine are not forgotten.

toc_entry.title: STATE SECRETS
toc_entry.description: Poor school districts strike it rich; nursing homes want more money too; the savings and loans aren’t banking on Bill Clements; a veto for political buttons.
